title: "This Week In React #166: Server Components, Waku, React-Forget, React-Native, Expo, Million, Remotion, Next.js, Storybook, Remix, AuthKit, Expo Router, Reactotron, Unistyles, Skia, SEO, CSS, Oxlint..."

segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!

segments.content: This has been a quite exciting week in terms of news!
segments.sourceMdx: This has been a quite exciting week in terms of news!

segments.content: We had a few great React releases and articles. It's great to see React-Forget slowly being rolled out on Instagram. Remotion also started to demonstrate its full potential with the GitHub Unwrapped launch.
segments.sourceMdx: We had a few great React releases and articles. It's great to see React-Forget slowly being rolled out on Instagram. Remotion also started to demonstrate its full potential with the GitHub Unwrapped launch.

segments.content: React-Native is on fire, with v0.73 stable, Expo SDK 50 and Expo Router v3 in beta and a few other great releases. What excites me most is Expo gradually unveiling its plan to support Universal React Server Components.
segments.sourceMdx: React-Native is on fire, with v0.73 stable, Expo SDK 50 and Expo Router v3 in beta and a few other great releases. What excites me most is Expo gradually unveiling its plan to support Universal React Server Components.

segments.content: This week's issue is quite special for me: it's the very first time I'm not alone writing the content. [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt) almost wrote the entire React-Native section. I haven't used React-Native in production since 2020 ğŸ˜… so it's nice to have someone using [all the cutting edge libs](https://github.com/bndkt/sharemystack) help me provide relevant insights.

I haven't used React-Native in production since 2020 ğŸ˜… so it's nice to have someone using [all the cutting edge libs](https://github.com/bndkt/sharemystack) help me provide relevant insights.

segments.content: Don't forget to fill in the [State of JavaScript](https://stateofjs.com/en-US) and [State of React-Native](https://stateofreactnative.com/) surveys. And if you could mention me at the end that's cool! [Theo T3 shows you how](https://youtube.com/clip/UgkxDdNASo6xNS710ODcjMx0WW4HtTxIYbrA?si=G0rAnDKOQwHqh_ED) ğŸ˜„

segments.content: A new kind of dev tool for React just opened its beta. See your JSX and styles in action while running your build. Hop quickly to your favorite editor. Use dragâ€™nâ€™drop and generative AI to update your app. As you work, MightyMeld generates clean code ready to merge as part of your PR. [Free to use](https://www.mightymeld.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=newsletter\&utm_campaign=1\&utm_content=body).

segments.content: [![Waku](/emails/issues/166/waku.jpg)](https://waku.gg/blog/introducing-waku)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Waku](/emails/issues/166/waku.jpg)](https://waku.gg/blog/introducing-waku)

segments.content: [**Waku - Minimal React Framework that enhances React Server Component usage**](https://waku.gg/blog/introducing-waku)
segments.sourceMdx: [**Waku - Minimal React Framework that enhances React Server Component usage**](https://waku.gg/blog/introducing-waku)

segments.content:
We already featured this one, but the v0.18 rewrite is out, and includes a little introduction blog post.
Waku is a minimal React framework that allows us to explore the core RSC capabilities, free from the traditional SSG/SSR strategies. Technically it is a Vite-based bundler that outputs pure JS and supports deployment to edge runtimes. Now sponsored by Vercel.
segments.sourceMdx:
We already featured this one, but the v0.18 rewrite is out, and includes a little introduction blog post.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [Developer Nation Survey - For each completed response, Developer Nation will donate to one of the charities of respondentsâ€™ choosing! Start now!](https://developereconomics.net/?member_id=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=nl_ad2)
* ğŸ¿ [Remotion - GitHub Unwrapped 2023](https://githubunwrapped.com/): this year Remotion partnered with GitHub to produce the GitHub Unwrapped video ([here is mine](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1734622460547342693)). A great showcase for the type of videos that can be produced using React.
* ğŸ¦ [React hydration error diff demo](https://twitter.com/samijaber_/status/1734332721634099282): revival of interest for this much needed feature ([new React PR](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/27808)).
* ğŸ¦ [Tanner Linsley about React concurrent model vs reactive model](https://twitter.com/tannerlinsley/status/1732474127712481371): on the difficulty to get the benefits of both models at once. Tanner finally migrated the upcoming TanStack Router to a reactive model ([visual demo](https://x.com/aryan__deora/status/1733164876170764409)).
* ğŸ¦ [Next.js moving away from extending `fetch()`, adding new APIs like `noStore()`](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1733154383410684148)
* ğŸ“– [Next.js - Updated Server Actions docs - Includes how to use them outside forms, security recommendations, and best practices](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/data-fetching/server-actions-and-mutations)
* ğŸ“– [Next.js React Foundations updated with App Router and Server Components](https://nextjs.org/learn/react-foundations)
* ğŸ“œ [A Chain Reaction](https://overreacted.io/a-chain-reaction/): Dan Abramov is back with great storytelling lesson through the implementation of a recursive function that renders JSX to platform elements.
* ğŸ“œ [Next.js 14: Layouts vs Templates](https://www.builder.io/blog/nextjs-14-layouts-templates): templates are remounted on navigation and reset their state.
* ğŸ“œ [Storybook for React Server Components](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-react-server-components/): Storybook 8 is now in alpha. In includes experimental Next.js RSC support. In practice RSCs will run client-side and you have to mock networks and Node.js APIs.
* ğŸ“œ [The anatomy of shadcn/ui](https://manupa.dev/blog/anatomy-of-shadcn-ui): gives a great overview of the popular Radix + Tailwind lÌ¶iÌ¶bÌ¶rÌ¶aÌ¶rÌ¶yÌ¶, and how it assembles various packages to provide a good DX.
* ğŸ“œ [How to set up self-healing URLs in Next.js for better SEO](https://mikebifulco.com/posts/self-healing-urls-nextjs-seo): shows how to create Next.js urls that are both human-readable and include a stable id. You can change the article title/url without breaking old links.
* ğŸ“œ [Remix - Submit a form without overwriting existing parameters](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/existing-params): suggests to use a `<ExistingSearchParams>` to append existing params to the form.
* ğŸ“œ [Polymorphism in React - 2 patterns you must know](https://www.bekk.christmas/post/2023/01/polymorphism-in-react)
* ğŸ“œ [Lexical state updates](https://dio.la/article/lexical-state-updates)
* ğŸ“¦ [React DevTools 5.0 - New React-Forget badge](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/27759): new feature permits to see Meta's rollout of React-Forget in production on Instagram ([ref](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1734607171030303186)).
* ğŸ“¦ [Million.js 3.0 - Overhauled version, faster drop-in replacement](https://million.dev/blog/million-3)
* ğŸ“¦ [AuthKit - The world's best login box powered by WorkOS and Radix](https://www.authkit.com/)
* ğŸ“¦ [react-hook-form 7.49 - react-server bundle, reactive errors prop...](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/releases/tag/v7.49.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [Next-Admin 3.0 - App router support](https://github.com/premieroctet/next-admin/releases/tag/%40premieroctet%2Fnext-admin%403.0.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [Epic Stack - Client Hints - Eliminate flashes of incorrect content](https://github.com/epicweb-dev/client-hints)

segments.content: [![Open-source React Framework for building enterprise B2B apps](/emails/issues/166/about.jpg)](https://s.refine.dev/github-repo)
segments.sourceMdx: [![Open-source React Framework for building enterprise B2B apps](/emails/issues/166/about.jpg)](https://s.refine.dev/github-repo)

segments.content: **[Open-source React Framework for building enterprise B2B apps](https://s.refine.dev/github-repo)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[Open-source React Framework for building enterprise B2B apps](https://s.refine.dev/github-repo)**

segments.content: Refine streamlines the building of production-ready B2B apps like internal tools and dashboards.
segments.sourceMdx: Refine streamlines the building of production-ready B2B apps like internal tools and dashboards.

segments.content: It is designed to address the specific pain points of larger organizations, giving top priority to security and reducing repetitive tasks with its hooks and components.
segments.sourceMdx: It is designed to address the specific pain points of larger organizations, giving top priority to security and reducing repetitive tasks with its hooks and components.

segments.content: Offers industry-standard solutions for critical project aspects like **authentication**, **access control**, **routing**, **networking**, and **state management**.
segments.sourceMdx: Offers industry-standard solutions for critical project aspects like **authentication**, **access control**, **routing**, **networking**, and **state management**.

* ğŸ¦ [interpolate() in React Native Reanimated - visually understand extrapolation](https://x.com/kacperkapusciak/status/1732794213371097491)
* ğŸ“– [Expo introduces canary releases](https://docs.expo.dev/versions/latest/#canary-releases)
* ğŸ“œ [Expo EAS - Keep your cache close â€” Itâ€™s Faster!](https://expo.dev/changelog/2023/12-07-cocoapods-cache#how-to-speed-up-cocoapods): Expo cuts pod installation time by caching popular pods directly on their build VMs.
* ğŸ“œ [Integrate Firebase Analytics into Expo Router](https://tinybytelabs.com/blog/integrate-firebase-analytics-to-expo-router): unlike React-Navigation, Expo-Router is url-first, and you have to listen to pathname changes.
* ğŸ“œ [Creating a macOS MenuBar app with React Native](https://www.oskarkwasniewski.dev/blog/create-react-native-macos-menubar-app)
* ğŸ“œ [Epic Games vs Google - Trial Verdict, a Win for All Developers](https://www.epicgames.com/site/en-US/news/epic-v-google-trial-verdict-a-win-for-all-developers): might bring changes to the app stores rules regarding in-app-payment models and their 30% tax.
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native 0.73](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/12/06/0.73-debugging-improvements-stable-symlinks) with a new debugger intended to replace Flipper, stable Symlink support in Metro (important in monorepos) and a new Kotlin template for Android (+ Android 14 support).
* ğŸ“¦ [Expo SDK 50 beta](https://expo.dev/changelog/2023/12-12-sdk-50-beta): upgrades to React-Native 0.73, with a new Expo Dev Tools Plugin API, a complete rewrite of `expo-sqlite`, improved `expo-camera`, a new library to figure out compatibility between a JS bundle and a particular native build (`@expo/fingerprint`), `expo-updates` hooks API, EAS updates/rollouts and much more.
* ğŸ“¦ [Expo Router v3 beta](https://blog.expo.dev/expo-router-v3-beta-is-now-available-eab52baf1e3e): includes API routes, Bundle Splitting for web, and a ton of other new features. Universal React Server Components are coming to Expo!
* ğŸ“¦ [Reactotron 3.0](https://shift.infinite.red/announcing-reactotron-3-0-934b5a221bda): brings automatic tracking of all log messages, better Android device debugging, faster app launch time.
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Skia - 3D transformations](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/pull/2033): William Candillon posted a ğŸ¦ [demo](https://x.com/wcandillon/status/1733972374930837776)
* ğŸ“¦ [React-Native-Unistyles 2.0](https://reactnativeunistyles.vercel.app/)
* ğŸ“¦ [react-native-permissions 4.0 - iOS 17, Android 14 support](https://github.com/zoontek/react-native-permissions/releases/tag/4.0.0)
* ğŸ™ï¸ [Galaxies - Rocket Ship](https://podcast.galaxies.dev/): recent React-Native focused podcast worth discovering
